definition: to greet and usher in (guests, newcomers etc)/(Buddhism) to receive into the Pure Land
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: Waiters in the restaurant warmly welcome and guide customers.
sentences.chinese: 服務員熱情地接引着顧客。

sentences.english: The simple single-layer mode was redefined with the introduction of a non-linear space.
sentences.chinese: 簡單的單層模式被重新定義成用來接引的非線性空間。

sentences.english: We are connecting the guide shoe and casing shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在接引鞋和套管鞋。

sentences.english: We are connecting the guide shoe and the casing shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我們正在接引鞋和套管鞋。

sentences.english: But he was wise enough to use the opportunity to help guide three people.
sentences.chinese: 但是法師有大智慧正好利用這個機會接引衆生。

definition: Western Pure Land of Ultimate Bliss or Sukhavati (Sanskrit)
pinyin: xi1 fang1 ji2 le4 shi4 jie4

definition: time immemorial/origin of the universe/the world
lower bound (math.)/world of mortals/(of Gods) to descend to the world of mortals
Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
